bibl.title: Ben cao gang mu dictionary Vol1

sense.def: Pathological Condition zhi 痔 , piles, with irregular episodes of swelling and pain. Ben cao gang mu 本草綱目 Substance Entry can 蠶 quotes SJF : 風痔，腫痛發歇不定者是也 , “ Wind piles are those with irregular episodes of swelling and pain”. Feng zhong 風腫 , wind swelling [28]

Pathological Condition of a swelling brought forth by wind, with neither head nor root. The swelling is extreme, as if something had been inflated. There is no reddening and no pain. Zhu bing yuan hou lun 諸病源候論 28: 腫而因風所發，故謂之風腫 , “A swelling emerging because of wind. Hence one calls it ‘ wind swelling ’”. Ben cao gang mu 本草綱目 lists numerous conditions associated with ‘wind swelling’, such as tou mian feng zhong 頭面風腫 , wind swelling on the head and face, and feng zhong sao yang 風腫瘙癢 , wind swelling with itching.
